website_summaries.verdict: The UA Charged Commit 2 is a basic, budget-friendly gym shoe. While it cannot compete with the flagship trainers, it still ensures reliable performance for moderate training sessions.
pros: The Charged Commit 2 is considered a fairly comfortable shoe by most purchasers
It provides optimum stability and support for gym use and weight training, many testers claim
A good number of users find this model a reliable choice for daily casual wear
The shoe is also described as visually appealing by some people
A few buyers note that it feels rather light on the foot
The trainer is generally deemed as reasonably priced
cons: A couple of users have complained about the laces causing pressure points

customer_reviews.title: Bargain pair of gym trainers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after previously owning a pair of under armour engage trainers. These trainers are comfortable but do come up a bit bigger for some reason and seem slightly wider. The reason why I didn't buy another pair of engage trainers was that the heals wore down quickly and they were not reinforced, where as there's ones seem sturdier in the heal. For the price you cannot really moan and they do the job. Good trainers for gym classes.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but doubt the durability
customer_reviews.text: The fit is a least a half to one size bigger than Adidas which I usually wear. They work well as cross training footwear and are supportive and strong. However, 3 months in my left trainer is starting to wear through near my little toe. These trainers have had significant lockdown hammer but I would question the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mike P  Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and comfy. Just not for me unfortunately.
customer_reviews.text: Look great, but gym classes injured my calves as soon as I switched over to these. Switching back to my old new balance trainers has fixed the issues, so it's definitely these shoes, which is a great shame as they're pretty comfy and look good.
customer_reviews.author: Graculus

customer_reviews.title: Not hard wearing.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. But not vary hard wearing. After 3 months of light use the fabric in the heel has torn making the shoe rub. Would expect some wear and tear after 3 months but not to the extent were I have to but another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third pair of UA trainers, and all have suffered the same issue. The heel material gives away after very little wear, this latest pair I only wear 5 times and already the material has broken down revealing the plastic support. For me UA trainers on this 3rd strike they are definitely out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these as a ‘buy it again’ because the first pair were fantastic at a great price. Second pair arrived, clearly not just tried on but worn for a considerable amount of time. No Amazon, I bought new not second hand, you need to up your game as this loyal customer is not happy with your shoddy practices.
customer_reviews.author: MTP

customer_reviews.title: Go 1 size up!
customer_reviews.text: Normally take a size 45 - this was just too small, too tight for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff 48

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable look really good on bought them for the gym
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great trainers
customer_reviews.text: Fantasy tic pair of trainers. Great quality and cheaper than anywhere else as I saw them on Facebook and went straight to trusted old amazon for the best price.
customer_reviews.author: Rog

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes - regular fit
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of running shoes, have got a lot of use during lockdown!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love em!
customer_reviews.text: Love them, very very comfy and different colour to the usual Black n White Trainers
customer_reviews.author: adrian dyer

customer_reviews.title: Happy buyer
customer_reviews.text: First time buying under amour on here great fit and preferred color plus cheaper than most sites I've looked on
customer_reviews.author: Martin Truscott

customer_reviews.title: Looks and function
customer_reviews.text: Size 9.5 came up a little large but nothing an insole couldn't fix.Shoes are so comfortable and support ankle well Look great too!
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: under armour trainers. Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy trainers, look better than the picture. Very happy with the purchase. Nothing to complain about, good sturdy well made shoes.
customer_reviews.author: G Oliver

customer_reviews.title: they fit
customer_reviews.text: They fit well and are rather comfortable what more do you need
customer_reviews.author: daniel simpson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bit big but my fault I ordered a half size to big
customer_reviews.author: Eric Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with these shoes. Lots of cushioning, very comfortable. Great value for money
customer_reviews.author: D.G. TAGG

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's Charged Commit Tr 2.0 Fitness Shoes
feature_bullets: Lightweight mesh upper delivers complete breathability
Dual-external heel counter hugs for your foot for added stability
Leather, mid-foot saddle provides comfortable support
Cushioned sockliner moulds to the shape of your foot, eliminating slippage and providing ideal underfoot comfort
Charged Cushioning midsole absorbs impact and converts it into a responsive burst
